defs.docs:
A crate which contains primitives that are useful for implementation that uses staking
 approaches in general. Definitions related to sessions, slashing, etc go here.

attributes.value: / A crate which contains primitives that are useful for implementation that uses staking
/ approaches in general. Definitions related to sessions, slashing, etc go here.

defs.name: offence
defs.docs:
Common traits and types that are useful for describing offences for usage in environments
 that use staking.

attributes.value: / Common traits and types that are useful for describing offences for usage in environments
/ that use staking.

defs.name: Kind
defs.docs:
The kind of an offence, is a byte string representing some kind identifier
 e.g. `b"im-online:offlin"`, `b"babe:equivocatio"`

attributes.value: / The kind of an offence, is a byte string representing some kind identifier
/ e.g. `b"im-online:offlin"`, `b"babe:equivocatio"`

defs.name: OffenceCount
defs.docs: Number of times the offence of this authority was already reported in the past.

attributes.value: / Number of times the offence of this authority was already reported in the past.
/ Note that we don't buffer offence reporting, so every time we see a new offence
/ of the same kind, we will report past authorities again.
/ This counter keeps track of how many times the authority was already reported in the past,
/ so that we can slash it accordingly.

defs.name: Offence
defs.docs: A trait implemented by an offence report.

attributes.value: / A trait implemented by an offence report.
/ This trait assumes that the offence is legitimate and was validated already.
/ Examples of offences include: a BABE equivocation or a GRANDPA unjustified vote.

defs.name: ID
defs.docs: Identifier which is unique for this kind of an offence.

attributes.value: / Identifier which is unique for this kind of an offence.

defs.name: TimeSlot
defs.docs: A type that represents a point in time on an abstract timescale.

attributes.value: / A type that represents a point in time on an abstract timescale.
/ See `Offence::time_slot` for details. The only requirement is that such timescale could be
/ represented by a single `u128` value.

defs.name: offenders
defs.docs: The list of all offenders involved in this incident.

attributes.value: / The list of all offenders involved in this incident.
/ The list has no duplicates, so it is rather a set.

defs.name: session_index
defs.docs:
The session index that is used for querying the validator set for the `slash_fraction`
 function.

attributes.value: / The session index that is used for querying the validator set for the `slash_fraction`
/ function.
/ This is used for filtering historical sessions.

defs.name: validator_set_count
defs.docs: Return a validator set count at the time when the offence took place.

attributes.value: / Return a validator set count at the time when the offence took place.

defs.name: time_slot
defs.docs: A point in time when this offence happened.

attributes.value: / A point in time when this offence happened.
/ This is used for looking up offences that happened at the "same time".
/ The timescale is abstract and doesn't have to be the same across different implementations
/ of this trait. The value doesn't represent absolute timescale though since it is interpreted
/ along with the `session_index`. Two offences are considered to happen at the same time iff
/ both `session_index` and `time_slot` are equal.
/ As an example, for GRANDPA timescale could be a round number and for BABE it could be a slot
/ number. Note that for GRANDPA the round number is reset each epoch.

defs.name: slash_fraction
defs.docs:
A slash fraction of the total exposure that should be slashed for this
 particular offence kind for the given parameters that happened at a singular `TimeSlot`.

attributes.value: / A slash fraction of the total exposure that should be slashed for this
/ particular offence kind for the given parameters that happened at a singular `TimeSlot`.
/ `offenders_count` - the count of unique offending authorities. It is >0.
/ `validator_set_count` - the cardinality of the validator set at the time of offence.

defs.name: DuplicateReport
defs.docs: The report has already been sumbmitted.

attributes.value: / The report has already been sumbmitted.

defs.name: Other
defs.docs: Other error has happened.

attributes.value: / Other error has happened.

defs.name: OffenceError
defs.docs: Errors that may happen on offence reports.

attributes.value: / Errors that may happen on offence reports.

defs.name: ReportOffence
defs.docs: A trait for decoupling offence reporters from the actual handling of offence reports.

attributes.value: / A trait for decoupling offence reporters from the actual handling of offence reports.

defs.name: report_offence
defs.value: pub fn report_offence(Vec<Reporter>, O) -> Result<(), OffenceError>
defs.docs: Report an `offence` and reward given `reporters`.

attributes.value: / Report an `offence` and reward given `reporters`.

defs.name: is_known_offence
defs.docs:
Returns true iff all of the given offenders have been previously reported
 at the given time slot. This function is useful to prevent the sending of
 duplicate offence reports.

attributes.value: / Returns true iff all of the given offenders have been previously reported
/ at the given time slot. This function is useful to prevent the sending of
/ duplicate offence reports.

defs.name: OnOffenceHandler
defs.docs: A trait to take action on an offence.

attributes.value: / A trait to take action on an offence.
/ Used to decouple the module that handles offences and
/ the one that should punish for those offences.

defs.name: on_offence
defs.value:
pub fn on_offence(&[OffenceDetails<Reporter, Offender>], &[Perbill],
                  SessionIndex) -> Result<Res, ()>
defs.docs: A handler for an offence of a particular kind.

attributes.value: / A handler for an offence of a particular kind.
/ Note that this contains a list of all previous offenders
/ as well. The implementer should cater for a case, where
/ the same authorities were reported for the same offence
/ in the past (see `OffenceCount`).
/ The vector of `slash_fraction` contains `Perbill`s
/ the authorities should be slashed and is computed
/ according to the `OffenceCount` already. This is of the same length as `offenders.`
/ Zero is a valid value for a fraction.
/ The `session` parameter is the session index of the offence.
/ The receiver might decide to not accept this offence. In this case, the call site is
/ responsible for queuing the report and re-submitting again.

defs.name: can_report
defs.docs:
Can an offence be reported now or not. This is an method to short-circuit a call into
 `on_offence`. Ideally, a correct implementation should return `false` if `on_offence` will
 return `Err`. Nonetheless, this is up to the implementation and this trait cannot guarantee
 it.

attributes.value: / Can an offence be reported now or not. This is an method to short-circuit a call into
/ `on_offence`. Ideally, a correct implementation should return `false` if `on_offence` will
/ return `Err`. Nonetheless, this is up to the implementation and this trait cannot guarantee
/ it.

defs.name: OffenceDetails
defs.docs: A details about an offending authority for a particular kind of offence.

attributes.value: / A details about an offending authority for a particular kind of offence.

defs.name: offender
defs.docs: The offending authority id

attributes.value: / The offending authority id

defs.name: reporters
defs.docs:
A list of reporters of offences of this authority ID. Possibly empty where there are no
 particular reporters.

attributes.value: / A list of reporters of offences of this authority ID. Possibly empty where there are no
/ particular reporters.

defs.name: SessionIndex
defs.docs: Simple index type with which we can count sessions.

attributes.value: / Simple index type with which we can count sessions.
